author: davidtuan
title: dRep easy find potential proposals
description: Lack of a comprehensive support tool makes it easy for dReps to find potential recommendations.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal mentions in the introductory statement “dRep will be a key player in Catalyst's success by finding valuable and potential proposals”. However, I believe the role of dRep to be more than just that. It’s not about finding just the valuable proposals as much as it is about also finding unnecessary or even detrimental proposals. His role will be as an extended guardian of the protocol taking informed decisions in the place of the voters who entrust him with their voting power. I think the word “informed” is more appropriate in this context than “good” or “wrong”, as those can be subjective and altered.
That is why I believe a dRep should be reading as many proposals as he/she is comfortable with, in the domains is informed in and judge based on facts what the voting action will be.
Otherwise, I do agree that both tools that he mentioned could be improved, and some of the suggestions he has presented do make a valid point and could potentially improve the experience of dReps, PAs and voters. That is why I cannot determine whether I agree if the impact of this proposal could be positive, as it might make it too tempting, as the proposer put it, to “saves a lot of time and can quickly search for good and potential proposals to vote on”.
Perhaps if the proposer were to reconsider the purpose of the tool, that instead would help dReps make more informed judgements on all the proposals, then I think that would make for a very valuable tool.

f6_assessments.q0:
Currently, dReps, PAs and voters only have 2 tools to help them sort through proposals (cardanocataly.st & lidonation.com). However, they each are missing key elements to help filter the best proposals, and a lot of manual work is still required from the dReps to access all the information they need to make decisions on proposals.

The presenter is speaking from experience as he was a reviewer and voter in Fund8, and found getting the right information for each proposal to be a time consuming and frustrating process.

This project offers a solution to the problem by creating a website with detailed evaluation metrics and filters for each proposal that can easily be viewed and analyzed by voters, assessors and dReps to choose the best proposals more efficiently. The website will have a user friendly interface for ease of us by all participants.

This proposal is very well presented. It clearly states the current problem and the suggested solution. It definitely meets the challenge's goal as it will encourage and facilitate voters, assessors and dReps and by streamlining their work.
f6_assessments.q1:
The presenter has laid down a detailed step by step plan to implement the project in six months, split into two phases. From planning, architecture, design of UI & admin interface, branding, domain registration & hosting, functionality for web and smartphones, testing and ultimately promoting the finished product, he has covered it all. With 12 years experience in programming, and website and application development the presenter certainly has the expertise needed to execute this plan. 

However I am giving a 4 stars rating for Feasibility, because ,unfortunately, the presenter didn't provide a detailed budget breakdown for the identifiable tasks given in his proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
The presenter has not provided any information regarding the auditability of the KPIs other than the completion of the website itself.

As a side note, I would like to add that as a PA I feel this is an important project, and I would love to be able to use such a website to help sort through proposals. So please David, kindly complete your proposal's budget (time & cost per task) and provide a way to audit the KPIs (github) so that we may be able to give you the ratings this proposal deserves. Good luck!

Drep is a decentralized reputation ecosystem consisting of a public chain, a reputation-based protocol, and tools to power Internet platforms. Drep is a project created with the goal of building “connectors” and “toolkits” based on blockchain technology. Thanks to DApps (decentralized applications) it is possible to build multi-chain public versions, create wallets and asset trading platforms with just one click. dRep addresses the problem of poor public chain performance and insufficient developer experience, segregation of the public chain ecosystem and small user base on blockchain, mismatch between blockchain technology and demand. business demand.

f6_assessments.q0: This project presents the opportunity to streamline and simplify the data on each project, with the aim enhancing decision making on each project. From the script, we are inform of the idea behind  the project—to build a multi-criteria filter that makes it easy for dRep to find the best quality recommendation in a short amount of time. Obviously, with almost a 1000+ projects, voters are likely to vote randomly without recognition to data presented. Hence, the tools that aid them during voting must be quite simplified. In that regard, I think this project has the potential to enhance the current system or tools. In the end, we expect a more rational decision form voters with the assistance of this tool. Ultimately, we anticipate that the tool would offer Dreps and voters in general the opportunity to quickly access more promising project that offer value addition to the ecosystem and eventually save dRep and voters a lot of time in evaluating and voting on projects. I am also satisfied with the proponents proposed solution to the anticipated risk likely to confront the project
f6_assessments.q1: I wish more information is provided on the roadmap, team experience and budget to enable us determine the feasibility of the project. f6_assessments.q2: The information presented is not sufficient to audit the project's progress and success. We know from the proposal that, ultimately, the expectation here is that,  given the details presented on the roadmap, the budget and the team experience, the project should be implemented successfully to achieve the project’s objective. However, the proposer failed to present any significant KPIs to enable us assess, monitor and track the performance of the project. Additionally, the absence of specific milestones to be achieved within the roadmap makes it difficult to determine how well the project performs. Again, is the team prepared to provide any feedback from the project to the community? Finally, I think the proposer has a great idea but requires a lot of work at the feasibility and auditability section of the project to enhance the overall outlook of the project.
